SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Maintain Your Storefront's Third-Party JavaScript Dependencies

Continue to deliver a trusted storefront experience for your buyers and keep your storefront's third-party dependencies up to date. This release updates the default versions of several open-source JavaScript libraries distributed with the managed package.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Why: The updated libraries include:

LIBRARY	VERSION	WHAT'S CHANGED?
handlebars.js	4.7.6	Change log
jquery.hoverintent.js	1.10.1	Change log
jquery.validate.js	1.19.2	Change log
nouislider.js	14.6.2	Change log
underscore.js	1.11.0	Change log
NOTE This release also includes the following updated libraries that have already been patched in all previous versions of B2B Commerce for Visualforce:
jquery.js version 3.5.1
jquery-migrate.js version 3.3.0

For more information about these updates, see Salesforce Knowledge: Upgrade to jQuery 3.5.1 in B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (Version 4.12) or Earlier.

How: After you upgrade the managed package, the default implementation of the ccrz.cc_hk_UserInterface:v004 extension class references these updated libraries by default. To start using the updated libraries on your storefront, build and activate a new configuration cache.

If you previously extended the default ccrz.cc_hk_UserInterface class to customize the front-end libraries, update your extension to reference the latest versions of these libraries. If you reference these libraries from other locations in your code, update those references, as well.

SEE ALSO
Default JavaScript Libraries for Storefront Pages
